definition: Organisms that hunt and consume other organisms, referred to as prey.
Organisms that are hunted and consumed by predators.
An island in Lake Superior, noted here for its isolated moose and wolf populations.
Scientists who study the natural world, especially plants and animals in their natural environments.
The condition when an organism or species no longer exists.
Scientists who study ecosystems and the interactions among organisms and their environment.
A North American hare, known for its large back feet and its ability to adapt to snowy environments.
A North American wild cat that preys primarily on the snowshoe hare.
Fluctuations or repeated variations in size or quantity.
A group of aquatic organisms that have a compressed body enclosed within a hinged shell, such as clams, oysters, mussels, and scallops.
Dominating a particular area or environment to the exclusion of other species.
